intro: Scilla flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag scilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often curved leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun. Scilla flexuosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and early blooming habit.
